00014 // .NAME vtkMrmlData - Abstract Object used in the slicer to perform
00015 // everything related to the access and display of data.
00016 // .SECTION Description
00017 // Used in conjunction with a vtkMrmlNode (which neatly describes
00018 // display settings, file locations, etc.).  Essentially, the MRML 
00019 // node gives the high level description of what this class should 
00020 // actually do with the data
00021 // 
00022 
00023 // NEED TO:
00024 // make vtkMrmlNode.h:: Copy constructor to be virtual.
00025 //                   :: Destructor needs to be virtual.
00026 // 
00027 // GetMTime to be virtual
00028

00030 #define __vtkMrmlData_h

00046 class VTK_SLICER_BASE_EXPORT vtkMrmlData : public vtkProcessObject {
00047   public:
00048     static vtkMrmlData *New();
00049 
00050   vtkTypeMacro(vtkMrmlData,vtkProcessObject);
00051   void PrintSelf(ostream& os, vtkIndent indent);
00052   
00053   // 
00054   // Dealing With Mrml Data
00055   //
00056 
00057   // Description:
00058   // Set/Get the MRML info
00059   vtkSetObjectMacro(MrmlNode, vtkMrmlNode);
00060   vtkGetObjectMacro(MrmlNode, vtkMrmlNode);
00061   
00062   // Description:
00063   // Copy another MmrlData's MrmlNode to this one
00064   // This does not need to be virtual 
00065   void CopyNode(vtkMrmlData *Data);
00066 
00067   //
00068   // Making sure the filters are UpToDate
00069   //
00070 
00071   // Description:
00072   // Provides opportunity to insure internal consistency before access.
00073   // Transfers all ivars from MrmlNode to internal VTK objects
00074   //
00075   // All subclasses MUST call vtkMRMLData::Update and vtkMRMLData::GetMTime
00076   virtual void Update();
00077   virtual unsigned long int GetMTime();
00078 //  virtual vtkObject* GetOutput();
00079   vtkDataObject *GetOutput();
00080 
00081   //
00082   // Read/Write filters
00083   //
00084 
00085   // Description:
00086   // Read/Write the data
00087   // Return 1 on success, 0 on failure.
00088   virtual int Read() = 0;
00089   virtual int Write() = 0;
00090 
00091   // Description:
00092   // Has the object been changed in a way that one would want to write
00093   // it to disk? (to replace IsDirty...)
00094   vtkSetMacro(NeedToWrite, int);
00095   vtkGetMacro(NeedToWrite, int);
00096   vtkBooleanMacro(NeedToWrite, int);
00097 
00098   //
00099   // Display functions
00100   //
00101 
00102   // Description:
00103   // Get the indirect LUT (LookupTable).
00104   // If UseLabelLUT is on, then returns the LabelLUT, otherwise
00105   // the volume's own IndirectLookupTable.
00106   vtkIndirectLookupTable *GetIndirectLUT();
00107 
00108   // Description:
00109   // Set Label IndirectLookupTable
00110   vtkGetMacro(UseLabelIndirectLUT, int);
00111   vtkSetMacro(UseLabelIndirectLUT, int);
00112   vtkBooleanMacro(UseLabelIndirectLUT, int);
00113   vtkSetObjectMacro(LabelIndirectLUT, vtkIndirectLookupTable);
00114   vtkGetObjectMacro(LabelIndirectLUT, vtkIndirectLookupTable);
00115 
00116   // Description:
00117   // Set LookupTable
00118   void SetLookupTable(vtkLookupTable *lut) {
00119       this->IndirectLUT->SetLookupTable(lut);};
00120   vtkLookupTable *GetLookupTable() {
00121     return this->IndirectLUT->GetLookupTable();};
00122 
00123   // Description:
00124   // Enable or disable FMRI mapping 
00125   void EnableFMRIMapping(int yes) {
00126       this->IndirectLUT->SetFMRIMapping(yes);};
00127 
00128   // Description:
00129   // For internal use during Read/Write
00130   vtkGetObjectMacro(ProcessObject, vtkProcessObject);
00131

00143   // If MrmlNode is None, create it.
00144   virtual void CheckMrmlNode();
